pageProps.content:
Experience

Ngoma Safari Lodge is located within the Chobe Forest Reserve in Western Botswana, a mere 3 km from the Chobe National Park. This region is renowned for its outstanding wildlife, including the famous Chobe Elephants, & home to more than 75 mammals & 450 bird species.
The lodge is set on the edge of a plateau, offering endless views over the seasonal Chobe flood plains. Magnificent sunsets are celebrated here – the perfect way to end an African day.

Stay

Ngoma Safari Lodge boasts 8 river-facing suites, designed with an emphasis on space & comfort.
Each suite comes complete with air-conditioning, an en-suite bathroom with bath, indoor & outdoor showers, as well as a private living area with a plunge pool & sun loungers.
After lunch, guests love to spend time taking a dip in their plunge pools or relaxing in the sun while reading a book.

Activities

A Chobe safari includes both land & water activities.
Activities at Ngoma Safari Lodge include exciting morning game drives, night drives in the Forest Reserve concession or a full day drive with river cruise & picnic.
Visits to the local village may also be arranged.

subfolders.title: Chobe Game Lodge
subfolders.description: Chobe National Park, globally acclaimed as the 'home of elephants,' is a premier destination for those seeking an unforgettable Chobe National Park elephant safari experience. This remarkable park harbors Africa's largest congregation of wildlife, offering visitors unparalleled encounters with vast herds of elephants &amp buffaloes. In fact, about 120,000 elephants live in & around the national park, & inconceivable numbers of these gentle giants can be seen crowding the banks of the Chobe River during Botswana’s dry season from May to October.

subfolders.title: Chobe Princess
subfolders.description: The Chobe Princess is a luxury houseboat based on the Chobe River in Botswana, but it is officially a joint Namibian & Botswana property as the river forms the boundary between these two countries. A unique & elegant experience, The Chobe Princess will take you on a journey through some of Africa’s most beautiful & scenic regions.

subfolders.title: Chobe Savanna Lodge
subfolders.description: Chobe Savanna Lodge is set in the Eastern Caprivi, a narrow strip of country on the Northern bank of the Chobe River.  The lodge enjoys spectacular views over the Chobe National Park, home to large herds of elephants, buffalo & hippo. The most prominent feature at Chobe Savanna is a thatched open-sided section of the lodge where guests can enjoy a 270 degrees view over the Chobe River & Chobe National Park.

subfolders.title: Chobe Under Canvas
subfolders.description: Chobe Under Canvas is a luxury mobile camp, ideally positioned close to the Chobe River in the world-renowned Chobe National Park. A Botswana safari is not complete without a visit to Chobe where large herds of elephants & buffalo are frequently seen.  Chobe Under Canvas combines rustic luxury with iconic wildlife encounters, & therefore is a wildlife enthusiast’s dream come true.

subfolders.title: Elephant Valley Lodge
subfolders.description: Elephant Valley Lodge lies between the world-renowned Chobe National Park & the Matetsi Wildlife Conservancy in the Kasane Forest Reserve of Botswana. The lodge overlooks an extremely productive waterhole, which serves as one of the main attractions at camp as passing wildlife often gather here.

subfolders.title: Sanctuary Chobe Chilwero
subfolders.description: Chobe Chilwero is set deep in the heart of the Botswana wilderness & borders the world-famous Chobe National Park.  Its superb location on the edge of the Chobe River allows for magnificent sunsets & breathtaking scenery. Game viewing in this area is phenomenal, especially in the dryer winter months when animals make their way towards the river, one of their only life sources in the area.
